intro: Dinoseris, commonly known as the golden dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and basal rosettes of leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Dinoseris species are native to southern Africa and are adapted to arid environments. Its medicinal properties have been studied for their potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial effects.
